*Geometry art class.*

üìú The Instructions

Area of Triangles -

Read through the lesson and find the appropriate activities for your children.

This is a Power Lesson. Power lessons are used to increase your students' level of math mastery. You can do this by submitting a video of your students doing the activity at the end of this lesson or a picture/scan of their written work.

üéí 1. Gear Checklist

Gather these exact items:

Post-it notes or paper & tape

Play dough or clay

Graph paper

Rulers or tape measures for older students

üéØ 2. Your Objectives

I can find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing and decomposing into rectangles, triangles and/or other shapes. (6.G.1)

I can use these techniques to solve real-world and mathematical problems. (6.G.1)

üß† 3. Brain Download (The Lesson)

Watch this video that gives a good explanation of how the formula for finding the area of a triangle works: (watch just the first 5 minutes)

Area of a Triangle Lesson and

üó∫Ô∏è 4. The Adventure (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Activity

Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing and decomposing into rectangles, triangles and/or other shapes.

Using graph paper draw triangles and practice finding the area of a triangle. A= ¬Ω base X height; Here is a link to explore how to find the base and height of a triangle; Illustrative math.

Find the area of a rectangle, (this can be done by finding rectangles around the house or drawing them on graph paper) then divide it in half to find the area of a triangle that would fit in the rectangle. If drawing this on a graph paper, draw the triangle inside of the rectangle.

Here are links to activities on finding the area of polygons. You may choose to use one or both of these;

Illustrative math

Illustrative math

Extension:Quilt Triangles. This might be a fun extension activity to explore the area of triangles.

For some of the online activities you will need a free CK12 account.

To create a CK12 account:

Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/

Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner

Choose the option for email to sign up.

Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask students to input their teacher email. PLEASE ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL: and the teacher will complete the registration process.

When registration is complete, the teacher will email you the username and password for your student account.

üí° üöÄ Mission Strategy: Step-by-Step

*(Use this guide to help you complete the instructions above)*

1. Draw a rectangle on graph paper. Count the squares to find Area (Base x Height).

2. Cut the rectangle in half diagonally.

3. Look! You have two triangles. That's why Triangle Area = 1/2 Base x Height.

4. Extension: Create a 'Quilt' pattern using different colored paper triangles.
